title: Hassan Kachal (Bald Hassan)

source_text.text:
Bald, unlucky Hassan is mocked for laziness. He leaves home, helps an old woman on the road, and learns of an ogre’s house holding treasure and a captive maiden.

Hassan sneaks in. The maiden begs for rescue and hands him a comb, a bag of salt, and a waterskin, warning him not to look back if they flee. They slip out while the ogre sleeps, but Hassan glances back and the ogre stirs.

The ogre wakes and charges after them. Hassan throws the comb, which becomes a dense forest; the ogre hacks through. He throws the salt, which rises into a jagged salt-crag mountain; the ogre claws it down. He finally throws the water, which swells into a river the ogre cannot cross.

With the path blocked, Hassan and the maiden reach town. The ogre abandons the chase, and Hassan marries the clever maiden, prized now for courage and wit.

thinking_process: Classic Iranian magic-flight variant: Hassan flees an ogre with a helper maiden; three transforming objects are thrown to halt pursuit.

motif.obstacle_thrower: Hassan throws the objects given by the maiden; she plans, he casts.

paragraph_summaries: Bald, idle Hassan leaves home, helps an old woman, and hears of an ogre’s house with treasure and a captive maiden.
He enters, frees the maiden, and she hands him three objects (comb, salt, water) for escape while warning him not to look back; they slip out, but his glance stirs the ogre.
The ogre wakes and pursues; Hassan and the maiden throw the comb, salt, and water, which become a forest, a salt-crag mountain, and a river that stalls the chase.
They reach safety, the ogre gives up, and Hassan marries the clever maiden with the townsfolk’s blessing.

source_text_persian.text: حسن کچل برای بخت‌آزمایی راه می‌افتد و در خانه‌ی دیو، دختر اسیر را نجات می‌دهد. دختر به او شانه، نمک و آب می‌دهد تا در فرار بیندازد. دیو دنبالشان می‌آید و حسن هر چیز را می‌اندازد؛ جنگل، کوه نمک و رود به راه می‌افتد و دیو جا می‌ماند. حسن و دختر سالم به شهر می‌رسند و عروسی می‌کنند.
